Hi,
I was running some profiling with execution time analysis and found that my logs were full of NPEs (see below).

Not sure what I was doing to cause them though.

Eugene,
  Would you be the owner of this bug.
Guru
Which release of TPTP are you using?

Would you please also list the step to reproduce the problem? 

It looks like you were making selection changed under the Profiling Monitor View on resource that does not have any profiling data for Execution Flow view.

Hi, I believe these problems were in version 4.1 of the TPTP.

To reproduce this, I checked the box 'Execution Time Analysis' in the Monitor tab of an application's run configuration, and then profiled the application.

I didn't notice when these exceptions were generated, I saw them after I had been doing some profiling. I will endevour to watch more carefully to see if it happens again.

Channing

I have not been able to reproduce using TPTP 4.2. Please advise if you are still running into this and if possible attach the source of a sample application which is giving you the null pointer Exceptions during profiling.

I haven't been doing any profiling lately but I'll repeat some of the work I was doing before to see if its reproduceable.

Channing

I am setting this to WORKSFORME for now as I can't reproduce the defect with the given information. Please re-open this if you run into it again and have a chance to attach a specific use case which produces the error.
